alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 3:21PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, southeast Siskiyou County. This includes he community of Tennant, and surrounding higher terrain. For the Winter Weather Advisory, areas north of Tennant and portions of Highway 97 in eastern Siskiyou County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM PDT Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected to become focused in the immediate Mt Shasta area and south overnight into Wednesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County
